item.title: CONTRIBUTING
item.description: Contributing Contributions to the yuzu Games Wiki are welcomed, as keeping all of the data up to date and accurate is a community effort. Table of Contents: Info About This Wiki Angle Brackets yuzu Version Dates GitHub Issues Screenshots Code Icon Game Screenshots Savefiles Save Metadata Save Data Wiki Info About This Wiki Angle Brackets Throughout this guide, code blocks like `` are used. This means that “Value” should be replaced by something, and the “<>” should be deleted.

item.title: README
item.description: yuzu Games Wiki This is a database of how games will work in the yuzu Nintendo Switch Emulator using TOML. The site generated from this info can be found here. If you interested in contributing, take a look at the Contributing Guide. For more info about yuzu, go here. The repository for the yuzu emulator can be found here, and the yuzu website here.

item.title: Edna & Harvey: Harvey's New Eyes
item.description: Shy schoolgirl Lilli is having a tough time at the convent. Only her imagination helps her to escape from the strict rule of Mother Superior. But when her best friend Edna disappears under mysterious circumstances, Lilli has to rise above her own and face a tough journey to not only get her friend back but also confront her subconscious fears. Lilli, a young girl at a convent school, is the main character of Edna & Harvey: Harvey’s New Eyes.

item.title: MONSTER HUNTER RISE
item.description: Known issue(s) with latest Yuzu: Texture oddity in main menu and in game. Example image Game also seems much more graphically broken on AMD GPUs, at the moment To avoid it somewhat you can try to boot game in Undocked mode (hit f10 or click it) and switch to Docked mode after you’ve selected continue game. This game will still require further work and development on the emu to address these issues or similar you may face that are visual related.

item.title: Outlast 2
item.description: Normally the game is unplayable due to a lighting issue. The steps to get the game working are listed below: Start the game and load a checkpoint after the intro at the bottom left of emulator when windowed, click GPU HIGH to switch gpu accuracy. Fiddling between the accuracy level ‘Normal’ - ‘High’ should help most lighting issues, however some minor (or major depending on your luck) may still appear.

Animal Crossing: New Horizons
item.description: Animal Crossing: New Horizons currently goes in-game. Known issues Special events can be played, but require game updates that change the middle number of the game’s version at least 1 step higher than the version in which the events should trigger via BCAT. For example, Toy day is playable from game version 1.7.0 instead of 1.6.0c, and festivale is playable from game version 1.8.0 instead of 1.7.0a No multiplayer support is available in any form (including but not limited to dream addresses & pattern exchange) Workarounds for some of these issues can be found on the Switch Mods page.

item.description: The game suffers from major glitches, making it unplayable on current state (yuzu 570). Issues On OpenGL, the game have glitched logos and menus, and crashes at the loading of a level. On Vulkan, the same glitch happens, but the image is mirrored upside down.

item.title: ASTRAL CHAIN
item.description: Astral chain is fully playable Leave anisotropic filter on default to avoid graphic issues IMPORTANT: This game have rendering delay/audio desync when loading cutscene/areas due to ASTC textures not being supported on Nvidia and AMD GPUs natively. There are 2 workarounds for this. First is enabling Accelerate ASTC Decoding in Graphics setting can help reduce decoding time (depends on GPU performance). Second, use Intel iGPU. Intel iGPUs support ASTC textures natively which means no delays during texture decoding.

item.title: Cadence of Hyrule – Crypt of the NecroDancer Featuring The Legend of Zelda
item.description: For the best compatibility, enable only the Pro Controller in the custom controller config. In addition, Docked Mode should also be enabled. Asynchronous GPU is now partially compatible with this title, enabling better performance while in use. This option can be found under Emulation > Configure... > Graphics > Use asynchronous GPU emulation. Known Issues Game speed seems to ignore the speed limiter on some/all systems with Asynchronous GPU enabled, even while using a Pro Controller config.

item.title: Cave Story+
item.description: Cave Story + Issues (Yuzu 592 - 04/17/2021) The game is fully playable from beginning to ending with few issues. Without update (Yuzu 2681 - 09/25/2019) When you try to teleport the game speed become locked to 25% https://ibb.co/Ksp7j0Y Using v1.2 update (Yuzu 592 - 04/17/2021) Runs nearly perfect. Game stutters if Graphics > Use asynchronous GPU emulation is ENABLED. (fix: uncheck.) Sound glitches (ultra speed) randomly. fix: restart emulation.

item.title: Crash™ Team Racing Nitro-Fueled
item.description: Crash Team Racing: Nitro Fueled is currently in a playable state. In order to have the best possible experience, please follow the instructions below: Dump and use your NAND and keys from your console following our quickstart guide. Under Controls, use either the Pro Controller or Dual Joycons controller options along with setting the Console Mode to Docked. Users on NVIDIA Pascal series GPUs (GTX 10xx) are recommended to use OpenGL to avoid rendering glitches.

item.title: Crypt of the NecroDancer: Nintendo Switch Edition
Cytus α
item.description: Cytus α is the evolutionary version of the popular mobile game, Cytus. The Switch version features new visuals and over 200 songs, including newly written songs and collaboration tracks. A new leaderboard mode is added where players can post scores against other players online. You play by focusing on the rhythm of the music. “Notes” (circular icons) and lines represent the music, with varied movements and interactions. With the right timing you TAP, DRAG and HOLD notes to earn the best possible score, using either the touch screen or a controller.

item.description: Daemon X Machina is currently in a playable state utilizing the OpenGL and Vulkan API. However, only the Vulkan API shows the proper text in-game and through the menus. Encountered Issues: OpenGL specific: Menu text is missing and makes navigating the entire menu system extremely difficult. Major textures and some effects are missing in and out of gameplay. Some slight slowdowns occur when specific enemies known as “Immortals” appear on screen in two or more quantities.

item.description: An atmospheric vehicle adventure that follows the emotional journey of a boy and his ship as he embarks on a voyage to find a new home. AN ALL-NEW COMPANION TITLE Expanding on the desolate setting seen in FAR: Lone Sails, Changing Tides swaps sun scorched, dusty planes for stormy skies and high seas. item.description: Make sure the game does not exceed a frame rate greater than 29. It will not work beyond the start kinematics. item.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe
item.description: Mario Kart 8 currently performs great in yuzu and is very stable with the game’s latest update. In order to have the best possible experience, please follow the instructions below: Dump and use your firmware-NAND and keys from your console following our quickstart guide. The firmware contains Mii data. Without it, the game crashes on boot. In Emulation-> Configure-> General, enable Multicore CPU Emulation for better performance. In the Controls configuration, use either the Pro Controller or Dual Joycons controller options.

Splatoon 2
item.description: Splatoon 2 and the Octo Expansion DLC are playable. Performance is currently sub-par compared to most other titles on yuzu. A machine with decent hardware is recommended. Issues: Using assembly shaders causes multiple rendering issues with shading and Inkling bodies on NVIDIA Pascal and Maxwell GPUs (i.e. GeForce 9- and 10-series) [issue]. Asynchronous shader compilation randomly causes terrain to become unnavigable as if covered by enemy ink [issue]. It also may cause certain objects/areas to not respond to user ink.

item.title: Super Mario Maker 2
item.description: Super Mario Maker 2 is currently in a playable state. In order to have the best possible experience, please follow the instructions below: Dump and use your NAND and keys from your console following our quickstart guide. Under Controls, use either the Pro Controller or Dual Joycons controller options along with setting the Console Mode to Docked. As with most emulators, your in-game performance is highly dependent on the power of your system.

item.title: Super Mario Maker™ 2 + Nintendo Switch Online Bundle
Super Mario Odyssey
item.description: Super Mario Odyssey is currently in a playable state. In order to have the best possible experience, please follow the instructions below: Dump and use your NAND and keys from your console following our quickstart guide. Under Controls, use either the Pro Controller or Dual Joycons controller options along with setting the Console Mode to Docked. Using a compatible controller setup, configure your motion controls by clicking Motion 1 (and Motion 2 if you’re using Dual Joycons) and shaking your controller.

item.title: Super Mario Party

item.title: Super Mario™ 3D All-Stars
item.description: Super Mario 3D All-Star’s is playable, but issues may arise depending on your graphics stack (OpenGL/Vulkan + actual hardware). Known Issues: Only version 1.0.0 works, all updates (1.0.1, 1.1.0 and 1.1.1) are broken (game does not load). Screenshots Edit by DannyVT: I made my default to vulkan and changed the game property to run opengl (the “game” is 3 ports with different games inside) but after doing that it works fine.

item.description: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is playable. But some modes are unplayable as the services required by them is not implemented. You will require a firmware dump to play Mii levels. Issues: Some modes will trigger a crash. When a battle starts, sometimes the screen will stay black, with the audio still playing. Restarting the emulator helps. You cannot play local wireless and online as it is not implemented on yuzu. This game is very shader intensive; when you first play, this game stutters frequently to cache shaders.

item.title: Tetris 99
item.description: Tetris 99 launches and runs without any performance issues. The one problem that makes this game labeled as “bad” compatibility is that the tetrominoes will not display as well as the targeting lines; see image below for context. Here is what the game is supposed to look like. https://ibb.co/9Nssj4x And this is how the game works on yuzu, keep in mind that this Reddit post was made one year ago, on my hardware I am getting a stable 60 fps without changing any settings.

item.title: Tetris® Effect: Connected
item.description: Tetris Effect Connected is intermittently playable. This is due to the game hard crashing when making many types of screen transitions or effects. These include, but are not limited to: Pausing the game Mid-level transitions Finishing a level Exiting a level And a few more… Graphics Graphics are currently broken on OpenGL, at least on Nvidia GPUs. To solve most of these issues, set your rendering API to Vulkan Networking Issues The game will hard lock when attempting to access any online service such as leaderboards and player avatars and names.

item.title: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel III
The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
item.description: Breath of the Wild is fully playable currently. Issues: The player character assumes the colors of malice while standing in it Rain stutters or moves slowly Particle effects do not move correctly on normal accuracy Camera Rune cannot detect objects with high accuracy Rain looks stretched while shooting an arrow mid-air Runes doesn’t work with API vulkan AMD GPU users using Mesa should set the environment variable AMD_DEBUG=nohyperz to resolve black texture issues.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening
item.description: The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening is playable. Performance may struggle in demanding areas. Issues Using OpenGL: Tall grass and tree models have black flickering Depth of field (aka blurriness) is incorrectly rendered, causing the whole screen to appear blurred. This can be mitigated by using this mod patch. Lighting and grass shading may be incorrect. Water appears to not be transparent, and water surface reflections are too bright. Using Vulkan: Banding effects may occur on the terrain.

item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles 2
item.description: Xenoblade Chronicles 2 is playable with some occasional issues such as stuttering. Issues: The game gets random softlocks Some shadows may not render correctly Analog stick calibration: Character walks in certain left analog stick directions, but runs in other directions. To remedy this, please adjust your ‘Range’ in the Yuzu Input Config page for your Left stick that has issue. Lowering from default 100% to 60-80% is reported to have better results for this particular game.

item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles™ 3
item.description: Xenoblade Chronicles 3 is playable, despite several issues. Minor stuttering is to be expected, as well as some graphical issues, particularly with the Vulkan renderer backend. These issues can be avoided by using the OpenGL rendering backend, or by using mods. Crashes can happen after playing for some time, so we advise that you save often or use auto-saving. For Vulkan users, we highly recommend that you use the Bloom/Brightness Bug Workaround Mod to make the game significantly more playable.

item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles™ Definitive Edition
item.description: Xenoblade Chronicles Definitive Edition is playable Issues: lighting is too bright on some cutscenes anisotropic filtering causes cloud rendering issues stuttering and frame drops on some high-end machines Rainbow flickering is still present while using Mesa OPENGL and sometimes Vulkan with AMD GPUs Black Grass glitch appears when using windows Vulkan drivers with AMD GPUs. Game-specific configuration: Set GPU emulation accuracy to high Setting to extreme improves framerate, but introduces issues with facial animations in cutscenes.

Bounties
item.description: Below are the active bounties for yuzu. Want to request a bounty? Message one of our moderators or developers. How does the process work? Payments are to be sent via Paypal from the requester to the developer who opened the pull request, at the time the pull request has been opened. The requester then confirms the feature is complete via the latest version of Canary that has this pull request merged.

item.title: Community Rules
item.description: Warez/downloading games talk is prohibited. To prevent legal issues, you may not request or refer to any kind of ROM, NAND, ISO, game, or other copyrighted material that has been illegally obtained or shared. This rule also applies to pre-release leaks. We don’t allow discussion / support requests about games until they are officially released. If any post like that is found, the thread containing it will be locked and further support revoked.

item.title: Donations
item.description: Developing an emulator for a modern, complex system like the Nintendo Switch requires significant hard work and dedication from a large team of developers. We will never charge you for yuzu and will always make our source code freely available. We do not make any money from our work, however development has many expenses that are often paid out-of-pocket by our team members, among them Switch consoles to explore and reverse-engineer the hardware Switch games for testing, reverse-engineering, and implementing new features Web hosting and infrastructure setup Software licenses (e.

item.title: Downloads
item.description: Windows Instructions yuzu requires the latest versions of Microsoft Visual C++. Please download and install the dependency from below. Download Microsoft Visual C++ 2022 here! Windows Installer The installer will allow you to download your preferred release channel. If you are a Patreon subscriber, the “Early Access” channel will be available to you, and will provide early access to exciting experimental changes on top of what is available in the main channel.

item.title: Privacy Policy for the yuzu Emulator Project
item.description: The yuzu Emulator Project values your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your anonymized telemetry data when you use the yuzu application (the “App”), and how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use the website and forum. Information We Collect When you use the App, we may collect the following types of anonymized telemetry data:
